file_content.text: You have our gratitude for everything you've done.
The battle is won, my lord. The Foundry is ours.
And it shall be a fine weapon, once wielded properly.
This is how the Empire will prevail--not only through superior armament, but through superior individuals.
Without your team, we could never have struck such a blow or defeated the heretic Revan.
No other Sith could have struck such a blow or defeated the heretic Revan.
Without Intelligence, we could never have struck such a blow or defeated the heretic Revan.
Without your talents and... professionalism, we could never have struck such a blow or defeated the heretic Revan.
You could've told me who the Foundry's master really was.
Why didn't you mention Revan?
Revan has followers within the Empire, and the secret had to be kept. I apologize if you feel ill-used.
Three centuries ago, Revan was strong in the dark side--a fallen Jedi the Emperor took an interest in.
But he rebelled and had to suffer. Now his story is ended.
He would've destroyed the Empire, given a chance.
True enough.
His mind was damaged. But he wasn't always lost--I could tell that much.
He was a good man, once.
Beware your sympathies.
You had no right to keep that information from me.
I needed to know!
You misunderstand your role.
Thank you.
You got what you wanted. No need for the speech.
Enough jabbering.
Consider your tone--I am feeling tolerant today.
All true, but words won't pay your debt.
Compliments don't pay bills.
Storage units from my personal treasury are being delivered to the ship.
Our teams are going over the Foundry--it'll take some work, but everything should be salvageable. Even the HK unit, if we bother.
It may have useful memories, and it could be upgraded....
Regardless, we have a new army, and a victory for the ages--one to prove no would-be Sith or Jedi Master is a match for the Empire.
Celebrations have begun on Dromund Kaas, and soon the cheers of the people will become a battle cry as the true war begins.
The Republic will fall, and the Empire will crush its enemies one by one.
Great days are coming.
The people have a new Sith Lord to adore. Me.
I'm worth cheering for.
You rise through the ranks quickly.
Imperial Intelligence will be waiting for your call.
You know how to contact me.
I expect nothing less.
Glad to know my skills won't become obsolete.
Sounds like good business.
Not for many years to come.
We've hurt the Republic. It doesn't need to go any further.
Total war isn't inevitable.
So long as one world resists, the Empire is not complete.
I helped you once, but I'm not your personal enforcer. Remember that.
Don't drag me into more.
We helped you once, but we're not your personal strike team. Remember that.
Don't drag us into more.
I shall.
Enjoy the fruits of your success. With your help, the galaxy will become a much different place.
The Republic cruiser is ready for you. You can leave for the Foundry at any time.
Moff Phennir. You said Malgus wanted to talk?
Yes, while we're refitting the Republic cruiser.
You have done well, all of you. Had we such strength in the last war, the Treaty of Coruscant might not have been needed.
We're honored, my lord.
But now a greater challenge awaits. I have studied the information from the Republic vessel, and I am now certain of the Foundry's nature.
What have you discovered, Lord Malgus?
Tell me.
You're an expert on it, now?
You're an expert on it, now?
I know the history of war--and three times, space stations matching the Foundry's specifications have changed the course of nations.
You said the Emperor's been after it for three hundred years. I assume it has value.
It must be worth a lot.
Indeed.
The Foundry's specifications match those of three other space stations known by history.
Each of these legendary stations could manufacture technology on a massive scale. One xenoformed planets; another built fleets of ships.
The Star Forges....
The Foundry creates endless armies of droids, commanded by the Foundry's Jedi Master--a man very likely mad after his long imprisonment.
How long until the Republic ship is ready for takeoff?
Then we'd better get moving.
It's nearly ready now.
If this man controls the Foundry's armies, we need to know how he thinks.
Tell me about the Jedi.
At his prime, he was a powerful warrior, a general and a skilled tactician. A legend to some. Now, I cannot say.
A disastrous combination.
Moff Phennir, you may proceed.
The Foundry is built into an asteroid surrounded by the Republic fleet. The cruiser we captured should pass their blockade without interference.
You will fly the cruiser directly to the Foundry and lead the ground assault, while our ships jump from hyperspace to engage the fleet.
The Foundry will be ours, and you will eliminate the Jedi Master.
The Republic will not forget this day. Nor will the Jedi.
For the Empire!
There's much I can learn from these ancient builders.
The Foundry should be useful.
Then secure the Foundry for your own sake.
I'll make sure the assault goes as planned. You make sure to take out the fleet.
We'll all do our parts.
Moff Phennir has my complete faith.
Not every day you fight a three-hundred-year-old Jedi.
This'll be a job to remember.
It is a privilege I envy you.
You won't be going, Malgus?
Much as I would like to handle this personally, other matters require my attention.
I've aided you willingly so far. But suppose we succeed--what do I get, besides accolades?
Let's talk about repayment.
The spoils and plunder of victory--but more than that, the allegiance of many among the Sith and the military.
I knew about the Jedi Master, but these superdroids will cost you.
Let's talk about money.
You will have everything you could desire.
It isn't just the Foundry we fight for--we fight to prove to the galaxy that the Empire is unstoppable.
Glory to the Sith, and to the Emperor.
The boarding parties are ready. They'll follow your lead.
Tell the Red Shrike to hold position until they're patched--they're not doing us any good.
Yes, sir.
And get those engineers a shuttle!
Moff Phennir? Darth Malgus sent us.
Moff Phennir? Darth Malgus sent me.
My lord, it's an honor to commit myself and my fleet to your cause. The Sith shall lead us to glory in the Emperor's name.
Glad to have Intelligence aboard--I've always thought our ministries should work more closely.
After all, the Sith honor us equally, and we should be partners in upholding their glory.
The mercenary, yes. Your skills are an inspiration.
Let me assure you that I consider you a partner in this venture--the Sith have chosen you to lead, and the people shall follow.
The strike force, yes. It's an honor to have you with us.
Let me assure you that my fleet and I are here as your support; you will lead in the Emperor's name, and the people shall follow.
You and your men will know triumph today.
Prepare for a great battle.
Yes, my lord.
It wasn't long ago that I was a slave. Now, I have a fleet behind me.
It's good to be in power.
Power begets power, my lord.
Glory to the Sith and to the Empire, of course.
Hail to the Emperor.
Glory and honor won't pay for blaster bolts. Understood?
Just keep the credits coming.
Understood.
The Empire and the Mandalorians, working side-by-side again.
Glory to Mandalore.
It is a good day.
Most men in your position aren't eager to work with me.
You're friendly, for a Moff.
I'm proud of earning my position, but a great Moff must be selfless--we live and die for the Sith.
I came for a briefing, not your pledge of support.
Don't bother with niceties.
Tell Darth Malgus we're ready.
This is Darth Malgus to the Imperial strike force. The Emperor's prisoner--the escaped Jedi Master--has unwittingly led us to the Nanth'ri system.
That is the location of the Foundry--an ancient alien space station embedded inside an asteroid.
The full capabilities of the Foundry remain a mystery, but the Jedi Master who discovered it will do anything to protect it. The Republic fleet is already on guard.
What are our options for an approach?
We'll need a way inside.
You said the space station is of alien design?
Tell me about the Foundry.
Yes. Built by a species that once ruled the galaxy, whose technologies make our own look primitive. Our Jedi Master knew their secrets well.
The enemy won't last long.
We are en route to intercept a Republic cruiser carrying supplies and reinforcements to the Foundry. We will immobilize the cruiser with a tractor beam.
You shall lead the boarding party. Once the cruiser is captured, you can use it to slip past the Republic defenses and infiltrate the Foundry itself.
We take the enemy vessel and use it for ourselves. Time we proceed.
Let's do this, then.
The Treaty of Coruscant still holds. There's not supposed to be direct war against the Republic.
Aren't we officially at peace?
The treaty is crumbling, day by day. This is more important, but do not underestimate the enemy.
Capture the cruiser? Not hard.
Once you have the cruiser and begin your attack on the Foundry, we will engage the Republic directly.
You must not underestimate the Republic defenses, or the Foundry's Jedi Master--he is the greatest threat. But your will is stronger.
We're in range of the Republic cruiser. Attempting to lock tractor beams.
We have them.
Get to the air lock and take that ship; it's the only way we can reach the Foundry.
Pardon me, but I need to confer with the fleet captains.
